content.prompt: Which of the following best explains why the government provides public goods?

choices.label: Nonexcludable goods have a perfectly inelastic demand.
Nonrival goods benefit only private consumers.
Surpluses result from the private production of nonrival goods.
Production of socially optimal quantities results in positive economic profits.
Nonexcludable goods are underproduced by private firms.
